{{Wireless embedded system |brand=AMIT |model=CDM531AM |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/13/2010 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=mobile hotspot |fcc_id=PBLCDM531AM |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1.2 |pwr_conn=USB Female Mini-B |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model=RT3050 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN29LV320BT-70TIP |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM63A165TS-6G |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3050 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |flags=portable,3G capable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.123.254 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui=00:50:18 |oui_eth=00:50:18 |default_ch= }} ''WiFi Mobile Router''
[http://www.zalip.com.tw/product.php?cate=19&pid=4 ZALiP product page] "11340Y20GA00003B1" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The device seems to be using a '''SiGe''' SE2597L / 2597L Power Amplifier IC. Default credentials are from the FCC manual. :The manual says the default SSID is the same as the MAC address. Assumed 00:50:18 ('''AMIT''') OUI based on the FCC label
